title: Gettysburg
description: Andy decides to motivate and inspire everyone by taking them on a field trip to Gettysburg. Some people in the office stay behind and Robert California asks them to come up with Dunder Mifflin/Sabre's next big idea.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: The Sabre Code of Conduct outlines the governing principles key to establishing and maintaining trust with our employees, clients-

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh my God, kill me!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey! All right, obviously we all want to die but we have to get through this. So, Gabe go ahead. It's okay.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Oh, is it okay with you? Because if it's not, you work for me, so... Comply with all applicable laws, regulations, policies and contracts governing our business. Be honest, fair-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [whispers to Jim] I'm gonna do it.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: And trustworthy in all your business activities and relationships. Treat one another-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh! I'm going into labor! Oh my goodness!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh okay, she's going into labor. Make way, everybody!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know it's wrong to fake going into labor just to get out of things, but sometimes it's necessary.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [after Angela gives her a stack of files]: I'm going into labor!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Or should I have corndogs. I mean-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm going into labor!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay, three reasons you are wrong about True Blood. Number one-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm going into labor.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Here we go!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey guys, uh, can't keep saying you're going into labor. Everyone knows you're full of it.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's not fair, you guys.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Pitiful.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: It's stupid.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Never cry wolf.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh. [liquid splatters]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh! Oh!

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Oh! Oh my goodness!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm really in labor! This is happening!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay guys, here we go! We'll see you!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How do you feel?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Drive carefully!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Good luck!

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Goodbye! Good luck! [empty bottle falls to the ground]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: False alarm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [on the phone] What?! They took another client from us? Okay, bye. Man! Business is war! Customers, clients- it's like a war out there.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I am a leader. But you can only inspire people so much in a place like this. So today I'm turning the inspire-factor up to ten with a little help from my friend America's bloodiest battle.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why even read business books? We should be studying war. Going to places like Gettysburg. Where is that?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: It's right here in PA.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [gags, coughs] Well we should take a fieldtrip there. I mean, that would be so cool. I wonder if that bus downstairs is-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay, Andy, we get it. It's a trip to Gettysburg.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That sounds super inspiring! I'm in!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gettysburg? Hmm. Could be interesting. Second-most northern battle in the Civil War.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Actually it is the northernmost.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ha!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The Civil War history industry has conveniently forgotten about the battle of Schrute Farms. [scoffs] Whatever. I'm over it. It's just grossly irresponsible.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Charge!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Well, this could be fun. I-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, well, the bus has free wifi and I made special low-sugar lunches for everyone. And is anyone kosher or halal?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What's the halal option?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dates, tabbouleh, and a bagel with cream cheese.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Out.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know, it's the same as the kosher option. There's a lesson in there. I mean, I can't force you to go. You're not my slaves. Thanks to Gettysburg. But... who's coming with me?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm in.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I'm in too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Guess I'm a sucker for historical fiction.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Anyone who's not going, you're dead to me. You're uninvited. I don't want you to come. But, FYI, there will be leftover turkey and pesto sammies in the fridge.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [passes out hats] One for you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Cool. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And one for you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Cool. Thanks. [puts his hat on Erin's head]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And- oh. You missed your head. [laughs and puts hat on Jim's head] There you go. Phyllis, think fast!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All right, guys, a little foreplay before we do it. Fans of Ken Burns' Jazz will most certainly enjoy Civil War.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You know, I just got Limitless on my iPad. I bet I could get it on the TV.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Ooh. Isn't that the one where the guy becomes limitless?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's just not appropri- I mean, if we were going to visit Bradley Cooper's birthplace, I'd be the first one suggesting it. I'd be rooting for it.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Limitless! Limitless! Limitless! Limitless!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All right, all right, all right.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Not food and stuff.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Here. Like it?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, if you buy the picnic table then you've got to get the fire pit.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can't get a fire pit. I have two babies.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: The fire pit is a no-brainer.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Oh, hi there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Plants and- hi, Robert! Hey, um, how are you doing? Good to see you again.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Where is everyone? Where is Andy?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Andy took some of the other people on a corporate retreat to Gettysburg.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Well, I was hoping to talk out some ideas with Andy. But what we have here... is perhaps better. By not going on the trip, you've shown you're the free-thinkers of the office.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Robert, you got your sheep and you got your black sheep, and I'm not even a sheep. I'm on the freaking moon.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: So, here what we can do. Game changers- changes to the game such that the game can never be played the same way again. Everyone, brainstorm some innovations. Don't be afraid to get weird with it. Meredith! [wakes her up] Excited!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [tries stapler/marker combo] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You guys...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: J-j-j-ju...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Get excited!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Shh! Movie's almost over.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All right! We're here. Limitless can wait.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Fun fact. In France, they call Limitless 'The Man with Many Capabilities.'

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Woo-hoo! Ladies and gentlemen the eighteen hundreds await you. We can watch Limitless on the way back.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I got Source Code on the way back.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Ooh! All right!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Woo!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa, where you going?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Visitor center. Gonna grab a map for the memorials, right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, we're not going to the visitor center. We're not tourists.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, of course we're not tourists. We're just people that aren't from here who are taking a tour.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, sign says "Begin tour here."

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Unless you're going on the very specially-created and meticulously-researched Andy Bernard tour.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: After Chancellorsville, Lee brought his army up the Shenandoah Valley, right through here! They stopped in this field for a picnic, which they called lunch.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [to Dwight] Yeah, but I'm confused...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Total deaths belongs to Gettysburg but when you're talking about D.P.A., that's deaths per acre...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: ...nothing beats the battle of Schrute Farms.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh. D.P.A. sounds way more important that total deaths.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, it is. And you should read some of these letters that the soldiers wrote home. I mean, it makes the battle of Gettysburg sound like a bunch of schoolgirls wrestling over a hairbrush. [laughs] I'm telling you, they're heartbreaking too. So beautifully written.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Dwight, what are you telling this girl?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The truth.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Stop filling her head with nonsense, okay? She doesn't know any better.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oscar, I am so glad you just got here. I would've believed everything he said.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no, no! You're filling her head with nonsense. You and the history books. I'm telling the truth.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Interesting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, thank you. All of history has been whitewashed.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Really? Why don't you tell us the real history, Gore Vidal?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, I will. I don't know who that is, but I'm gonna tell you this-

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: he's a historian.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Gettysburg was very important. Credit where credit is due, okay? Big, mad props to Gettysburg. Was it, however, the most northern battle of the civil war?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes, yes, yes!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not by a long shot!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, it was not!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Argh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, it was not. Was it the second-most northern?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sure! I will cede it was the second-most northernmost battle!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Erin-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Was it the northernmost? No. Get out of here, Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Get out of here!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I am so eager to hear your game-changers. Let's dig in, shall we?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: May I go first?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Raw fish- the disgusting food from Japan that Americans would never want to eat. Now, we can't get enough of it. From movie stars to construction workers, sushi is what's for dinner. Let me throw another idea at you. Origami. What? The crazy art of paper folding from, that's right, Japan. Don't you wish you could go back to 1980 and open the first sushi restaurant in Manhattan? We can do that! With... origami. It's the sushi of paper.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: This idea hasn't gripped me. What else did you come up with?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well I had to memorize the presentation, Robert, and it took a long time to build the swan, so-

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: That was bad.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: If your woman is like mine, I bet you come home to hear the same thing all the time. This paper is so hard. It scratches. Why can't there be a paper just for me? Well now there is. 'Papyr.' Paper for women. It's pink, scented and silky soft. Now, you can watch the game and she can write a letter to her sister.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: The situation you described, returning home to a wife complaining about her paper being too masculine, is not one I'm familiar with.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: In the African-American community-

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [murmurs] Thought it was worth a try.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That's fascinating. Tell me, what's the significance of the peach orchard, thought?

quotes.speaker: Park Ranger
quotes.text: Oh, well, that's a great question. Actually some of the most-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Excuse me, I got a question for you.

quotes.speaker: Park Ranger
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Can you tell us about the battle of Schrute Farms?

quotes.speaker: Park Ranger
quotes.text: Uh, I haven't heard of that one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really. Okay, follow-up question. How much are they paying you to keep your mouth shut?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I apologize for my friend and for the Republicans who are cutting your funding.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We don't need to bother this poor gentleman. I know exactly where we're going. Giddy up! Tallyho!

quotes.speaker: Chelsea
quotes.text: [taps Gabe's shoulder] Are you Lincoln?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: No, no, I'm-

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Apparently, I bear a passing resemblance to Abraham Lincoln. Makes it kind of hard for me to go to places like museums, historical monuments, elementary schools... I don't see it.  Chelsea's Mom: Chelsea, give Mr. Lincoln your hat so I can take a picture.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Okay, Quick.

quotes.speaker: Man
quotes.text: Hey! Lincoln's starting. [light applause]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Oh, uh, no. No, no, no, no. I'm, uh, I'm actually with a tour group myself, so- [laughter] Hello! I'm Abraham Lincoln! Some people call me the great emancipator, but, uh, you might know me from the penny. [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay. You know the test booklets that they give out in all the schools. I was thinking that we could put a coupon in the back that people would mail in to us... and as, you know, as I tell it, I don't like it. Unless, of course, you are responding to it.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I am not.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Um, excuse me. I'm gonna go to the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: At this point, when you're this pregnant, it's kind of like senior spring. The other day I spit my gum out on the carpet.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Kevin, you've been quiet. I'm curious to know what your game-changer is.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Well, you know how in the vending machine they have the chocolate chip cookies in the A-1 spot? They do that 'cause they think A-1's the best spot for the best cookie. But the real best spot is D-4. Right? That's where the eyes go. So...

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Cookies. Cookie placement.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah. But not just the cookies, though. That was just a 'for instance.'

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Who else agrees with Kevin, that we're wasting facilities, manpower, on our underselling products when we should be pushing our top-performers? [everyone raises their hand, Robert laughs] There you go. Consensus.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay, we are now on a planet where Kevin is the most creative person around, and I am just some good-looking guy.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [as Lincoln] I just don't understand. It's 1865, victory is ours, I've saved the very soul of our nation, and yet... happiness eludes me. Oh, perhaps a trip to the theater will enliven my spirits.

quotes.speaker: Audience
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: 'Kay, so another thing about oatmeal cookies. Who even wants them? I mean, I've seen Toby eat one, like, once, but other than that... [scoffs] like, forget it.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Interesting. So what is Dunder Mifflin's oatmeal cookie? What is the product that no one wants?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: how about that two-hole-punch letter? Only the lawyers want that punch at the top and they use legal.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: That's the oatmeal cookie. Fantastic, Kevin. Fantastic. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: By the way, did we leave all the food on the bus?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Let's talk about food for a second. Food for thought.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, that's what I had for breakfast and I think that's probably why I'm still hungry.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hunger! Hunger for victory! Hunger for honor. Hunger for pride.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hunger for hamburger.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hunger for chicken chimichangas. Right, Darryl?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That's good.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Exactly. Now do you know the Civil War soldiers were hungry for? Pride! Now, each battalion had its own flag and they guarded these flags with their lives. Colonel Harrison Jeffords of the Fourth Michigan Infantry saw his flag being carried away, chased it down with nothing but a sword. Fought tooth and nail at the foot of that flag until he died. He wasn't about to let them have that flag. Pride. Right, guys? [holds up flag] I commissioned this flag for Dunder Mifflin. Cost me two hundred dollars.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Only two hundred dollars?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We are all branches on this tree. And from the tree comes paper. We're all part of a business. But business is war. What's that I hear? Uh, a rebel paper company is coming to take our flag! Wha- what's going on here? Wee-hoo! Come and get it! Who's gonna get the flag? Who's getting it? Whoa! Hey! Ho! Don't look where I am, look where I'm going. Juke right, juke left.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Andy, this is inappropriate. People died here, man.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Get the flag! Get the flag! Come on, Big Tuna. What you gonna do about it? We got a flag right here. Wee-hoo!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Spangler Springs is a mile this way.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh wow.  So that's two miles if you incorporate the walk back.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Its... I mean come on.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I don't think I should walk anymore.  You know all I had for breakfast was oatmeal, yogurt, coffee, orange juice and toast.  Two poached eggs.  And then half a sandwich on the bus.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright fine.  You know what - I guess this place just hasn't rubbed off on you the way I hoped it would.  I'm still going.  And I'm not going to ask anymore.  I'm not even going to look back.  I'm just going to assume that you're with me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Andy looks back to find everyone sitting] You said you weren't going to look back.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: And why is Black Rock suddenly the paragon by which all hedge funds must now be compared?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Right.  I mean you're an accountant.  Those bogus prospectuses must drive you insane.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes.  I am an accountant.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Dwight - this is one of the archivists here.  I thought maybe we could consult him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well.  Anyone employed by the Gettysburg Industrial Complex is certainly going to want to keep quiet about the Battle of Schrute Farms.

quotes.speaker: Archivist
quotes.text: Schrute Farms did you say?  That is a fascinating little chapter of the Civil War.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You've heard about it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: YES!  Ha!  Prepare to be refuted!  Go on.

quotes.speaker: Archivist
quotes.text: There you go.

quotes.speaker: Narrator
quotes.text: Families and sweethearts back home waited desperately for letters from the front.

quotes.speaker: Soldier
quotes.text: Dearest mother I'm sorry it has been so long since my last letter.  It is three months since I arrived at Schrute Farms and I fear I may never leave this place alive.  Melvin Fifer Garris.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hallowed ground.

quotes.speaker: Narrator
quotes.text: But the Battle at Schrute Farms was no battle at all.  It was a code used by pacifists from both North and South who turned the Pennsylvania farmhouse into an artistic community and a refuge from the war.

quotes.speaker: Amanda
quotes.text: [on film] You have to understand.  Poets, artists, dancers - these kind of men preferred peace to war.  These delicate lovely men found a place of refuge among the Schrutes at Schrute Farms.  Amidst the macho brutality of war this was a place where dandies and dreamers could put on plays and sing tender ballads and dance in the moonlight.  I like to think of Schrute Farms as the Underground Railroad for the sensitive... and well... fabulous.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Wow.  This is so much better than the story you made up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I've seen enough.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You're right.  There should be a monument to this.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Never trust a cookie with a woman's name.  Pecan Sandy.  Lorna Doone.  Madeline.  They'll just break your heart.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [laughing] Kevin!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Robert I hate to interrupt.  But I would love to pitch you one last idea.  I call it the Big Mac idea.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What?!? No!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Big Mac idea.  That sounds encouraging.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It's really, really good Robert.  Let me explain.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No!  This is not fair!  This is my idea.  He's trying to steal it because he's jealous of me.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Well what is the idea?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Every time you buy a Big Mac you set one ingredient aside.  Then at the end of the week you have a free Big Mac.  And you love it even more because you made it with your own hands.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You know what?  Now I remember.  That was your idea. [patting Kevin on the back] That is 100 percent your idea.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Oh my.  It was just actually cookies the whole time?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [making pencil imprint] Dammit.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You guys came.  Where's everyone else?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Back at the bus.  We were locked out.  Phyllis is sitting on the ground eating a dirty sandwich.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah I asked the bus driver to lock it because our stuff was in there.  I guess he follows orders.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah sorry everyone else didn't come.  I think they're just tired.  With holes in their shoes.  And they have dysentery.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Even without an audience you're still at it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Our office has a disease.  And it goes by many names.  Sarcasm.  Snark.  Wisecracks.  You take things people care about and you make them feel lame about it with your jokes.  That's what you did with this trip.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy - this whole idea of our situation being just like war?  It's just not true.  We just work at a paper company.  And you're our regional manager.  And guess what man?  You don't have to prove anything.  We like you as regional manager.  Andy if you don't believe me take a look at what's on my head.  I'm wearing a very pink hat.  I've been getting weird looks all day because I'm pretty sure "DM does GB" means something kinda sexual.  But guess who's wearing them?  All of us.  Just for you man.  That's huge.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You don't like the hats?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: They're terrible.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I hate myself.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: They just didn't turn out how I wanted.  In my head they were cooler, but they do look weird.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [voiceover the three walking] The world will little note, nor long remember the fight Jim and I had here at Gettysburg and that's good because I was basically wrong.  I wanted my team to be, like, this army and I was their general.  But I guess it's really more like they're just people who work in an office and I'm their manager.  Yeah that's really probably a better analogy now that I think about it.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Abe and Mary are seated watching the show. [in Lincoln voice] Oh Mary this is wonderful... Ok Mary stop your scolding.  I'll be quiet. [aside to the audience] I need her like I need a hole in the head! [scattered chuckles from the crowd] [Gabe raises his hand with a finger pointed in the shape of a gun to his head] BANG!  Ooh [Gabe falls to the ground and the crowd claps, Gabe picks up the Lincoln hat, bows, runs to the crowd and trades it back for his pink "DM does GB" hat and runs off]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Haha! There he is. You mind lending a hand? I'm typing up a memo to share your ideas with the board.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I can do that.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Great....ok.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Your arm feels good on my back.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: For some reason, my boss is obsessed with cookies. It's not my specialty. My specialty is pizza. But I'm flexible.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Charge!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Isn't Gettysburg like three hours away?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No. It's like two hours and forty-six minutes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's kind of a haul, so we should probably get going. And tuna, I made a special sandwich for you, guess which kind.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Tuna?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes! Tuna of the land. Turkey. With pesto.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And to drink?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Water.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh-ho, I am in.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm excited, I've actually never been to Gettysburg. Uh, my family was gonna go once, but then my brothers convinced me if was full of dead soldier zombies, so I freaked out and we turned the car around. But I'm older now, I can outrun a zombie.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Getting everyone on the bus, check. Giving everyone hats, check. Sexiest eastern European girls, uh, check.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey, Devil's Den is that way, we should check it out. That's where the snipers hid.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Please! Everyone and their mother goes to Devil's Den. It's the Olive Garden of Gettysburg.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, I like Olive Garden.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, I meant that in a bad way. Obviously it tastes good, but it's not cool.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Where do all the cool kids go when they come to this consecrated ground?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That is what I'm showing you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know what you guys are all thinking right now: Hey, let's go pee on the grave of some confederate soldiers, but you know what? Joke's on you. It only makes the flowers grow back more beautifully.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Best thing you can do for the deceased is to pee on their graves. Then you dance and work the urine into the root systems. Doesn't hurt to have a smile on your face, either.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Guys! Over here, we found the bus.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Open the door, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's locked.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Are you sure? Yeah, it's locked.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's not locked, gimme that...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's weird, if it's not locked, why isn't it opening?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's, it's latched closed.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, you know what? Andy probably has the number for this guy. I'm gonna find him.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'll come with you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Ow! Ee! I sat on my sandwich.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: And that's how the printing press was invented.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [enters office doing Michael Jackson impression] Everybody beat it. Don't beat it, stay where you are.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: There you are. Dillinger Graphics said their shipment is late.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What did you say?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Nothing, I just-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What would you say?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: That it'll be the first shipment out today.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That is exactly the right thing to say! Do it! Git-er-done! Phyllis, you just married Joe Order, you're new name is Phyllis Order [fill this order], get it?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I don't get it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Jim, in regards to our high-five scheduled for four PM today, it has been moved up to now. Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We didn't have one scheduled.
